Replace.Text: Building a theater for the first time grants you a Governor title [ICON_Governor]. Luxury resource tiles in your territory can be charged for protection by land melee units, providing output based on the resource base income and additional [ICON_GOLD] gold (food converted to the same amount of gold), which increases with technology and civic development. If you charge protection to the same tile multiple times within 15 turns (at online speed), you will receive a series of negative effects, including: [NEWLINE] City development [ICON_PRESSUREDOWN] slowdown [NEWLINE] City -1 [ICON_AMENITIESINSUFFICIENT] livability [NEWLINE] City -1 [ICON_HOUSINGINSUFFICIENT] population [NEWLINE] Luxury resources [ICON_PILLAGED] depleted [NEWLINE] City [ICON_BARBARIAN] rebellion.
Syracuse unique district, replacing the Theater Square, cheaper to build, and provides the standard adjacency bonus for each adjacent luxury resource.
Syracuse unique district, replacing the Theater Square, cheaper to build, and provides the standard adjacency bonus for each adjacent luxury resource.

Syracuse's unique unit, cannot be trained, cannot be promoted, can only be purchased with gold. Has a longer attack range, has the ability to hide, can only be seen by adjacent enemy units, ignores enemy control zones when moving. Gains a modifier from the ranged combat power of the strongest unit ever produced by the city.

Syracuse's unique unit, cannot be trained, cannot be promoted, can only be purchased with gold. Has a longer attack range, has the ability to hide, can only be seen by adjacent enemy units, ignores enemy control zones when moving. Gains a modifier from the ranged combat power of the strongest unit ever produced by the city.

All combat units gain -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength, but can provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] gold, and an additional +1 for each age the unit survives. [NEWLINE] Gain the unique unit "Wolf Shadow" after the city is established, and gain one "Wolf Shadow" every 12 turns (at online speed), up to a maximum of three.

Night Servant unique unit, cannot be trained or purchased, cannot be promoted. Its base [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength is equal to the Combat Strength of the strongest unit ever produced by the city. +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for each Wolf Shadow adjacent to it.

Night Servant unique unit, cannot be trained or purchased, cannot be promoted. Its base [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength is equal to the Combat Strength of the strongest unit ever produced by the city. +1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for each Wolf Shadow adjacent to it.
Combat Unit -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength (Night Guard)
+1 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for each wolf shadow adjacent to you
Each combat unit provides +1 [ICON_GOLD] gold to the civilization, which increases with the era (Night Servant)
Owns the unique family governor: the Rossetti family. Build a city to gain 3 additional territories, and reduce the cost of purchasing cells by 20%.

Has a unique family governor: the Bellone family. A city with a happy habitability provides 0.2 [ICON_SCIENCE] science, 0.2 [ICON_CULTURE] culture and 0.4 [ICON_GOLD] gold per population point; if the habitability is ecstatic, the output is doubled. Ability to switch the town square buildings through projects.

Land units gain the ability to jump, and can move after jumping. The jump distance is equal to the unit's maximum movement, which increases by one every two eras. After a combat unit kills a unit for the first time, it recovers half of its [ICON_DAMAGED] health and all of its [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement, and it refreshes again after being promoted.

Land units gain the ability to jump, and can move after jumping. The jump distance is equal to the unit's upper limit of movement, which increases by one level every two eras. After the combat unit kills a unit for the first time, half of its health and full movement are restored, and it will be refreshed again after being promoted. (Silent Texas)

Has a unique family governor: House Saluzzo. When combat units attack stationed units, they gain +3 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength, ignoring combat strength reductions caused by injuries and terrain.
+3 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking stationed units. (Lappland)
Combat units ignore damage and combat effectiveness penalties caused by terrain. (Lappland)
Reduces this city's Loyalty by 1 per turn. If the city has an incumbent Governor, gives an additional +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Unlocks the Rossetti Family Residence. The capital gains the Rossetti Family Residence when first appointed in the capital. The Family Residence increases the city's Amenity by +1 [ICON_AMENITIES].
In a city with a Rossetti family residence, the regional building +1 corresponds to the regional output (+2 gold coins).
Cities with a Rossetti family station will generate +25% [ICON_GREATPERSON] Great Person Points per turn
-20% cost when purchasing units in the city, +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement for trained pioneers
If the city has a Theater Square, you can build another district regardless of the [ICON_CITIZEN] population limit
+1 use for builders trained in the city. +3 [ICON_SCIENCE] for each [ICON_GREATWORK_WRITING] work in a city with a Rossetti family station
Reduce this city's Loyalty by 1 per turn. If the city has an incumbent Governor, give an additional +3 [ICON_GOLD] gold.

Unlocks the Bellone Family Residence. When first appointed in a capital, the capital gains the Bellone Family Residence. A Bellone Family Residence increases the city's Amenity by +1 [ICON_AMENITIES].
Cities with a House Bellone Residence gain +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Wonders, and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per Wonder.
Cities with a Bellone Family Headquarters and adjacent to a Theater Square [ICON_CULTURE] +50% Culture bonus.
-20% cost when purchasing buildings in your city.
Each building in the Theater Square of your city provides +3 [ICON_GOLD] gold to International Trade Routes.
All districts of the city have [ICON_CULTURE] cultural output converted to 100% [ICON_TOURISM] tourism. Cities with a Bellone Family Station provide +2 [ICON_CULTURE] culture per district.
Reduces this city's Loyalty by 1 per turn. If the city has an incumbent Governor, it gains an additional +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards unit production.
Unlocks the Saluzzo Family Settlement. When first appointed in a capital, the capital gains the Saluzzo Family Settlement. A Family Settlement increases a city's Amenity by +1 [ICON_AMENITIES].
Cities with a Saluzzo House garrison gain +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from garrisoned units.
Cities with a Saluzzo seat provide 1 unlocked but unimproved strategic resource per turn.

Military units trained in the city will initially receive a free upgrade if they do not have one, and gain [ICON_CULTURE] culture equal to 25% of their [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength when they kill a unit.
+50% flanking bonus for combat units trained in your city.
Military units trained in the city can be moved after upgrading. Cities with Saluzzo Family garrisons gain +4 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength.
When you kill a unit, you gain [ICON_CULTURE] culture equal to 25% of its [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength (Saluzzo family)
